Attributes.description: Philosophical topics in the cognitive sciences, such as empiricism vs. nativism, consciousness, mental representation, cognitive architecture, language and thought, and situated cognition.
Attributes.prereq: Pre-reqs: (PHIL 441 (Philosophy of Perception), or PHIL 451 (Philosophy of Mind), or 6 credits of Philosophy at the 200-level or above (excluding PHIL 220 and PHIL 320).)
Attributes.date_buildings: Term: 2, Days: Tue Thu, Start Time: 9:30, End Time: 11:00, Building: Buchanan, Room: B310
